intro: Dendroviguiera eriophora var. poblana, commonly known as the Mexican tree mallow, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in limestone soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine. Its growth habit and foliage make it a unique addition to botanical gardens and landscapes.
